verses.original:
अङ्गं हरेः पुलकभूषणमाश्रयन्ती
भृङ्गाङ्गनेव मुकुलाभरणं तमालम् ।
अङ्गीकृताखिलविभूतिरपाङ्गलीला
माङ्गल्यदास्तु मम मङ्गळदेवतायाः ॥
verses.transliteration:
aṅgaṁ hareḥ pulakabhūṣaṇamāśrayantī
bhṛṅgāṅganeva mukulābharaṇaṁ tamālam |
aṅgīkṛtākhilavibhūtirapāṅgalīlā
māṅgalyadāstu mama maṅgaḷadevatāyāḥ ||

translations.english: Like a female bee clinging to a Tāmāla tree adorned with flower buds (Lord Hari), the limb that causes goosebumps (ecstasy) on Hari, embracing all forms of prosperity—may that playful side-glance of the Goddess of auspiciousness grant me auspiciousness.

verses.original:
मुग्धा मुहुर्विदधती वदने मुरारेः
प्रेमत्रपाप्रणिहितानि गतागतानि ।
माला दृशोर्मधुकरीव महोत्पले या
सा मे श्रियं दिशतु सागरसम्भवायाः ॥
verses.transliteration:
mugdhā muhurvidadhatī vadane murāreḥ
prematrapāpraṇihitāni gatāgataṁni |
mālā dṛśormadhukarīva mahotpale yā
sā me śriyaṁ diśatu sāgarasambhāvāyāḥ ||

translations.english: The one whose innocent gaze, mixed with love and shyness, comes and goes repeatedly upon the face of Murāri (Vishnu); the string of glances, like a female bee hovering over a blue lotus—may She, the daughter of the ocean, bestow prosperity upon me.

verses.original:
विश्वामरेन्द्रपदविभ्रमदानदक्षम्
आनन्दहेतुरधिकं मुरविद्विषोऽपि ।
ईषन्निषीदतु मयि क्षणमीक्षणार्धम्
इन्दीवरोदरसहोदरमिन्दिरायाः ॥
verses.transliteration:
viśvāmarendrapadavibhramadānadakṣam
ānandaheturadhikaṁ muravidviṣo'pi |
īṣanniṣīdatu mayi kṣaṇamīkṣaṇārdham
indīvarodarasahodaraminidrāyāḥ ||

translations.english: That half-glance of Indirā (Lakshmi), which is capable of granting the status of the ruler of the Devas, and is a great source of bliss even for the enemy of Mura (Vishnu)—may that glance, which resembles the inner beauty of a blue lotus, briefly settle upon me.

verses.original:
आमीलिताक्षमधिगम्य मुदा मुकुन्दम्
आनन्दकन्दमनिमेषमनङ्गतन्त्रम् ।
आकेकरस्थितकनीनिकपक्ष्मनेत्रं
भूत्यै भवेन्मम भुजङ्गशयाङ्गनायाः ॥
verses.transliteration:
āmīlitākṣamadhigamya mudā mukundam
ānandakandamanimeṣamanaṅgatantram |
ākekarasthitakanīnikapakṣmanetraṁ
bhūtyai bhavenmama bhujaṅgaśayāṅganāyāḥ ||

translations.english: The eye with slightly closed lids, fixed on Mukunda (Vishnu), who is the source of joy, unwavering, and the essence of the science of love; may that sideways-glancing eye of the wife of the one who rests on the serpent bring me prosperity.

verses.original:
बाह्वन्तरे मधुजितः श्रितकौस्तुभे या
हारावलीव हरिनीलमयी विभाति ।
कामप्रदा भगवतोऽपि कटाक्षमाला
कल्याणमावहतु मे कमलालयायाः ॥
verses.transliteration:
bāhvantare madhujitaḥ śritakaustubhe yā
hārāvalīva harinīlamayī vibhāti |
kāmapradā bhagavato'pi kaṭākṣamālā
kalyāṇamāvahatu me kamalālayāyāḥ ||

translations.english: In the arms of the conqueror of Madhu, on which the Kaustubha gem rests, shines a garland of glances like a necklace made of sapphire; may that series of glances of the one who resides in the lotus (Lakshmi), which fulfills the desires of even the Lord, bring me welfare.

verses.original:
कालाम्बुदालिललितोरसि कैटभारेः
धाराधरे स्फुरति या तटिदङ्गनेव ।
मातुस्समस्तजगतां महनीयमूर्तिः
भद्राणि मे दिशतु भार्गवनन्दनायाः ॥
verses.transliteration:
kālāmbudālilalitorasi kaiṭabhāreḥ
dhārādhare sphurati yā taṭidaṅganeva |
mātussamastajagatāṁ bahanīyamūrtiḥ
bhadrāṇi me diśatu bhārgavanandanāyāḥ ||

translations.english: On the pleasing chest of the enemy of Kaiṭabha (Vishnu), resembling a mass of dark clouds, She shines like a streak of lightning (Taṭit). May that revered form of the Mother of all worlds, the daughter of Bhṛgu (Lakshmi), grant me all good fortune.

verses.original:
प्राप्तं पदं प्रथमतः किल यत्प्रभावान्
माङ्गल्यभाजि मधुमाथिनि मन्मथेन ।
मय्यापतेत्तदिह मन्थरमीक्षणार्धम्
मन्दालसं च मकरालयकन्यकायाः ॥
verses.transliteration:
prāptaṁ padaṁ prathamataḥ kila yatprabhāvān
māṅgalyabhāji madhumāthini manmathena |
mayyāpatettadiha mantharamīkṣaṇārdham
mandālasaṁ ca makarālayakanyākāyāḥ ||

translations.english: That half-glance, by whose power Manmatha (Cupid) first obtained his place in the auspicious vanquisher of Madhu (Vishnu); may that slow and languid half-glance of the daughter of the ocean (Makara's abode) fall upon me here.

verses.original:
दद्याद्दयालुपवनो द्रविणाम्बुधाराम्
अस्मिन्नकिञ्चनविहङ्गशिशौ विषण्णे ।
दुष्कर्मघर्ममपनीय चिराय दूरं
नारायणप्रणयिनीनयनाम्बुवाहः ॥
verses.transliteration:
dadyāddhayālupavano draviṇāmbudhārām
asminnakiñcanavihaṅgaśiśau viṣaṇṇe |
duṣkarmagharmamapanīya cirāya dūraṁ
nārāyaṇapraṇayinīnayanāmbuvāhaḥ ||

translations.english: May the rain-cloud of the eye-glance of Nārāyaṇa's beloved (Lakshmi), driven by the wind of compassion, pour forth the rain of wealth upon this miserable young bird of a pauper (me), removing far away the heat of my bad Karma for a long time.

verses.original:
इष्टा विशिष्टमतयोऽपि यया दयार्द्रा
दृष्टास्त्रिविष्टपपदं सुलभे लभन्ते ।
दृष्टिः प्रहृष्टकमलोदरदीप्तिरिष्टां
पुष्टिं कृषीष्ट मम पुष्करविष्टरायाः ॥
verses.transliteration:
iṣṭā viśiṣṭamatayo'pi yayā dayārdrā
dṛṣṭāstriviṣṭapapadaṁ sulabhe labhante |
dṛṣṭiḥ prahṛṣṭakamalodaradiptiriṣṭāṁ
puṣṭiṁ kṛṣīṣṭa mama puṣkaraviṣṭarāyāḥ ||

translations.english: That glance, which, moist with mercy, when cast upon even distinguished persons, makes them easily attain the state of heaven (Triviṣṭapa); may that happy glance, which has the luster of the inside of a lotus, of the one seated on a lotus (Lakshmi), bring me the desired nourishment (prosperity).

verses.original:
गीर्देवतेति गरुडध्वजसुन्दरीति
शाकम्भरीति शशिशेखरवल्लभेति ।
सृष्टिस्थितिप्रलयकेलिषु संस्थितायै
तस्यै नमस्त्रिभुवनै कगुरोस्तरुण्यै ॥
verses.transliteration:
gīrdevateti garuḍadhvajasundarīti
śākambharīti śaśiśekharavallabheti |
sṛṣṭisthitipralayakeliṣu saṁsthitāyai
tasyai namastribhuvanaika-gurōstaruṇyai ||

translations.english: Salutations to the young wife of the sole preceptor of the three worlds (Vishnu), who is called the Goddess of speech (Sarasvatī), the beautiful one of the flag-bearer of Garuḍa (Lakshmi), Śākambharī (Goddess of vegetables), and the beloved of Śiva (Pārvatī), and who remains the basis for the sport of creation, maintenance, and dissolution.

verses.original:
श्रुत्यै नमोऽस्तु शुभकर्मफलप्रसूत्यै
रत्यै नमोऽस्तु रमणीयगुणार्णवायै ।
शक्त्यै नमोऽस्तु शतपत्रनिकेतनायै
पुष्ट्यै नमोऽस्तु पुरुषोत्तमवल्लभायै ॥
verses.transliteration:
śrutyai namo'stu śubhakarmaphalaprasūtyai
ratyai namo'stu ramaṇīyaguṇārṇavāyai |
śaktyai namo'stu śatapatraniketanaayai
puṣṭyai namo'stu puruṣottamavallabhāyai ||

translations.english: Salutations to the Śruti (Vedas), who brings forth the results of auspicious actions; salutations to Rati (Love), who is the ocean of charming virtues; salutations to Śakti (Power), who resides in the hundred-petaled lotus; salutations to Puṣṭi (Nourishment), who is the beloved of Puruṣottama (Vishnu).

verses.original:
नमोऽस्तु नालीकनिभाननायै
नमोऽस्तु दुग्धोदधिजन्मभूम्यै ।
नमोऽस्तु सोमामृतसोदरायै
नमोऽस्तु नारायणवल्लभायै ॥
verses.transliteration:
namo'stu nālīkanibhānanāyai
namo'stu dugdhodadhijanmabhūmyai |
namo'stu somāmṛtasodarāyai
namo'stu nārāyaṇavallabhāyai ||

translations.english: Salutations to Her whose face resembles a lotus; salutations to Her whose birthplace is the Ocean of Milk; salutations to Her, the sister of Soma (Moon) and Amṛta (Nectar); salutations to Her, the beloved of Nārāyaṇa.

verses.original:
नमोऽस्तु हेमाम्बुजपीठिकायै
नमोऽस्तु भूमण्डलनायिकायै ।
नमोऽस्तु देवादिदयापरायै
नमोऽस्तु शार्ङ्गायुधवल्लभायै ॥
verses.transliteration:
namo'stu hemāmbujapīṭhikāyai
namo'stu bhūmaṇḍalanāyikāyai |
namo'stu devādidayāparāyai
namo'stu śārṅgāyudhavallabhāyai ||

translations.english: Salutations to Her whose seat is a golden lotus; salutations to Her, the heroine of the entire world; salutations to Her, who is supremely merciful to the Devas and others; salutations to Her, the beloved of the one who wields the Śārṅga bow (Vishnu).

verses.original:
नमोऽस्तु देव्यै भृगुनन्दनायै
नमोऽस्तु विष्णोरुरसि स्थितायै ।
नमोऽस्तु लक्ष्म्यै कमलालयायै
नमोऽस्तु दामोदरवल्लभायै ॥
verses.transliteration:
namo'stu devyai bhṛgunandanāyai
namo'stu viṣṇorurasi sthitāyai |
namo'stu lakṣmyai kamalālayāyai
namo'stu dāmodaravallabhāyai ||

translations.english: Salutations to the Goddess, the daughter of Bhṛgu; salutations to Her who resides on Viṣṇu's chest; salutations to Lakshmī, who dwells in the lotus; salutations to Her, the beloved of Dāmodara (Vishnu).

verses.original:
नमोऽस्तु कान्त्यै कमलेक्षणायै
नमोऽस्तु भूत्यै भुवनप्रसूत्यै ।
नमोऽस्तु देवादिभिरर्चितायै
नमोऽस्तु नन्दात्मजवल्लभायै ॥
verses.transliteration:
namo'stu kāntyai kamalekṣaṇāyai
namo'stu bhūtyai bhuvanaprasūtyai |
namo'stu devādibhirarcitāyai
namo'stu nandātmajavallabhāyai ||

translations.english: Salutations to Kāntī (Lustre), whose eyes are like lotuses; salutations to Bhūtī (Prosperity), the creator of the universe; salutations to Her who is worshipped by Devas and others; salutations to Her, the beloved of Nanda's son (Kṛṣṇa/Vishnu).

verses.original:
सम्पत्कराणि सकलेन्द्रियनन्दनानि
साम्राज्यदानविभवानि सरोरुहाक्षि ।
त्वद्वन्दनानि दुरितोद्धरणोद्यतानि
मामेव मातरनिशं कलयन्तु मान्ये ॥
verses.transliteration:
sampatkarāṇi sakalendriyanandanāni
sāmrājyadānavibhavāni saroruhākṣi |
tvadvandanāni duritoddharaṇodyatāni
māmeva mātāraniśaṁ kalayantu mānye ||

translations.english: O lotus-eyed Mother! O revered one! May your salutations, which bring wealth, delight all senses, confer the glory of bestowing empire, and are ready to remove all sins, ever protect me.

verses.original:
यत्कटाक्षसमुपासनाविधिः
सेवकस्य सकलार्थसम्पदः ।\nसंविधातु सकलप्रसाधनं
त्वं सदास्तु मम सन्निधिप्रदा ॥
verses.transliteration:
yatkaṭākṣasamupāsanāvidhiḥ
sevakasya sakalārthasampadaḥ |
saṁvidhātu sakalaprasādhanaṁ
tvaṁ sadāstu mama sannidhipradā ||

translations.english: The ritualistic worship of your side-glance grants all wealth and fortune to the devotee; may You, who bestows all fulfillments, always grant me Your proximity.

verses.original:
गाढं दरिद्रभयभीतरतः कदाचित्
त्वद्पादपद्ममकुलाकुलतानिधानम् ।
दौर्गत्यभीतिहरणं त्वदपाङ्गदृष्टिः
मामेव मातरनिशं कलयन्तु मान्ये ॥
verses.transliteration:
gāḍhaṁ daridrabhayabhītarataḥ kadācit
tvadpādapadmamakulākulatānidhānam |
daurgatyabhītiharaṇaṁ tvadāpāṅgadṛṣṭiḥ
māmeva mātāraniśaṁ kalayantu mānye ||

translations.english: Once, greatly terrified by the fear of poverty, I took refuge at the beautiful lotus feet of the Goddess, which are the treasure of peace; O revered Mother! May your side-glance, which removes the fear of misfortune, constantly protect me.

verses.original:
नमोऽस्तु ते त्रिजगतां जननीं नमोऽस्तु
नमोऽस्तु ते श्रियममृतां नमोऽस्तु ।
नमोऽस्तु ते कमलिनीयै नमोऽस्तु
नमोऽस्तु ते दामोदरवल्लभायै ॥
verses.transliteration:
namo'stu te trijagatāṁ jananīṁ namo'stu
namo'stu te śriyamamṛtāṁ namo'stu |
namo'stu te kamalinīyai namo'stu
namo'stu te dāmodaravallabhāyai ||

translations.english: Salutations to You, the Mother of the three worlds; salutations to You, the immortal prosperity; salutations to You, the Goddess who possesses lotuses; salutations to You, the beloved of Dāmodara (Vishnu).

verses.original:
यः स्तोत्रमेतदपिधीत नित्यं
नित्यं रटन्ति ह्यरिजादियुक्तम् ।
प्राप्नोति नित्यं सकलार्थसिद्धिम्
लक्ष्मीं सदा स्यात्तव सन्निधिप्रदा ॥
verses.transliteration:
yaḥ stotrametadapidhīta nityaṁ
nityaṁ raṭanti hyarijādiyuktam |
prāpnoti nityaṁ sakalārthasiddhim
lakṣmīṁ sadā syāttava sannidhipradā ||

translations.english: Whoever daily recites this hymn, chanting the mantra related to Hari and the Beejākṣara, attains the constant fulfillment of all goals (Siddhis), and Lakshmī, the bestower of Your presence, will always be with them.

verses.original: इति श्रीमच्छङ्कराचार्यविरचितं कनकधारास्तोत्रं सम्पूर्णम् ॥
verses.transliteration: iti śrīmacchaṅkarācāryaviracitaṁ kanakadhārāstotraṁ sampūrṇam ||

translations.english: Thus ends the Kanakadhāra Stotram, composed by the illustrious Śaṅkarācārya.
